1.verse: The prophecy that Habakkuk the prophet received.

2.verse: How long, Lord , must I call for help,

3.verse: Why do you make me look at injustice?

6.verse: I am raising up the Babylonians,

7.verse: They are a feared and dreaded people;

8.verse: Their horses are swifter than leopards,

9.verse: they all come intent on violence.

11.verse: Then they sweep past like the wind and go on—

12.verse: Lord , are you not from everlasting?

13.verse: Your eyes are too pure to look on evil;

14.verse: You have made people like the fish in the sea,

15.verse: The wicked foe pulls all of them up with hooks,

16.verse: Therefore he sacrifices to his net

17.verse: Is he to keep on emptying his net,

1.verse: I will stand at my watch

3.verse: For the revelation awaits an appointed time;

6.verse: “Will not all of them taunt him with ridicule and scorn, saying,

7.verse: Will not your creditors suddenly arise?

8.verse: Because you have plundered many nations,

9.verse: “Woe to him who builds his house by unjust gain,

10.verse: You have plotted the ruin of many peoples,

11.verse: The stones of the wall will cry out,

12.verse: “Woe to him who builds a city with bloodshed

13.verse: Has not the Lord Almighty determined

14.verse: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord

15.verse: “Woe to him who gives drink to his neighbors,

16.verse: You will be filled with shame instead of glory.

17.verse: The violence you have done to Lebanon will overwhelm you,

18.verse: “Of what value is an idol carved by a craftsman?

19.verse: Woe to him who says to wood, ‘Come to life!’

20.verse: The Lord is in his holy temple;

1.verse: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet. On shigionoth .

2.verse: Lord , I have heard of your fame;

4.verse: His splendor was like the sunrise;

6.verse: He stood, and shook the earth;

7.verse: I saw the tents of Cushan in distress,

8.verse: Were you angry with the rivers, Lord ?

10.verse: the mountains saw you and writhed.

11.verse: Sun and moon stood still in the heavens

12.verse: In wrath you strode through the earth

13.verse: You came out to deliver your people,

14.verse: With his own spear you pierced his head

15.verse: You trampled the sea with your horses,

16.verse: I heard and my heart pounded,

17.verse: Though the fig tree does not bud

18.verse: yet I will rejoice in the Lord ,

19.verse: The Sovereign Lord is my strength;
